articles.title: Why 'Asian' isn't a one-size-fits-all term for many Canadians - CBC.ca
articles.description: During the month of May, many Canadians, especially those with South Asian roots, revisit a familiar inner dialogue about just what it means to be “Asian.”
articles.content:
What comes to mind when you hear the word "Asian"?
For Muhammad Akbar Ali, it's a complicated answer, and every year at this time, his mixed feelings get amplified during Asian Heritage Month.
